meta.name: Night of Vespers Investigator Expansion
meta.description: The upcoming Night of Vespers campaign was inspired by Thomas De Quincy’s Suspiria De Profundis, Giallo cinema, Dario Argento’s Le Tri Madri film trilogy, and Miskatonic River Press’s Our Ladies of Sorrow Call of Cthulhu campaign by Kevin Ross. The investigator expansion containins 5 investigators and 126 unique player cards, including 13 Specialist cards.
meta.author: Exhaled Innards (aughhhh)

cards.name: Bedevilled
cards.text: Revelation - Put Bedevilled into play in your threat area. Forced - When you fail a skill test during your turn: Lose all remaining actions and immediately end your turn. [reaction] At the end of your turn, test any skill (3). If you succeed, discard Bedevilled.

cards.flavor: "We both said a lot of things that we're going to regret, but I think we can put our differences behind us.  For science."
cards.name: Controversial Procedure
cards.text: [[Miskatonic]], [[Medic]], [[Scholar]] deck only. Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - You must decide: (Choose one.) - Deal 2 damage to an investigator at your location. You may discover up to 2 clues at your location or a connecting location. - Deal 2 horror to an investigator at your location. You may play a card from your hand. That card gains Fast and costs -2 resources.

cards.flavor: "Fine! None of this gets back to the missus, you hear me?"
cards.name: Izaak Orlofsky
cards.text:
[[Agency]], [[Criminal]], [[Detective]], [[Police]] deck only.
[reaction] At the end of your turn, heal 1 damage from Izaak Orlofsky.
[reaction] After you take damage from an enemy attack, exhaust Izaak Orlofsky: Shuffle the top 3 cards of your deck together and draw 1 of them. Discard the other 2 cards.

cards.flavor:
His ear heard more than what was said to him, and his slow speech had overtones of understanding beyond thought.
-John Steinbeck, Of Mice and Men
cards.name: Yorgos Kostopoulos
cards.text:
[[Clairvoyant]], [[Drifter]], [[Sorcerer]] deck only.
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After a Non-[[Humanoid]] enemy is defeated at your location, look at the top card of the encounter deck. You may choose to draw that card. If you do: Discover 1 clue at your location.

cards.name: Axis Mundi
cards.text:
[[Clairvoyant]], [[Drifter]], [[Wayfarer]] deck only.
Play only as your first action. You must decide (choose one):
- Move all clues at your location to any number of connecting locations.
- Choose a connecting location. Move all clues at that location to your current location.
Once you have made your decision, immediately end your turn and remove Axis Mundi from the game.

cards.flavor:
"‘Oaka e ka lani noke nō
‘Uhī a ‘uhā mai ana ‘o Pele!"
-Traditional chant of Halemaʻumaʻu Crater
cards.name: Tutu Pele's Tobacco Pipe
cards.text: [[Criminal]], [[Drifter]], [[Wayfarer]] deck only. Forced - At the beginning of the investigation phase, test [willpower] (2+X), where X is the number of enemies at your location. If you fail: Exhaust Tutu Pele's Tobacco Pipe. While Tutu Pele's Tobacco Pipe is ready, each non-[[Elite]] enemy at gains Aloof, and you may use your [agility] to Investigate.

cards.name: Anastasis
cards.text:
[[Blessed]], [[Chosen]], [[Sorcerer]] deck only. Exceptional.
[reaction] When an [[Ally]] card under your control would be defeated or discarded from play: Attach it face down beneath Anastasis, instead. (Limit 3 cards attached in this way.)
[free] If there are 3 total cards attached to Anastasis: Shuffle each card beneath Anastasis and choose 1 without looking at it. Put that card into play under your control. Then, shuffle the other 2 cards back into your deck.

cards.name: Vanity
cards.text: Multiplayer only. Revelation - Put Vanity into play in your threat area. Each other investigator at your location gets -2 to all tests. [action][action]: Discard Vanity. You may not activate this ability if Vanity is in your own threat area.

cards.name: Delirious
cards.text: Revelation - Put Delirious into play in your threat area. Forced - As an additional cost to enter a revealed location with a shroud of 4 or higher, you must spend 1 action. [reaction] After you enter a location with a shroud of 4 or higher, test any skill (3). If you succeed: Discard Delirious.

cards.name: Infested
cards.text: Revelation - Put Infested into play in your threat area. Forced - At the beginning of the investigation phase, put 1 resource token on Infested from the token bank. If there are 3 resource tokens on Infested, take 3 direct damage and discard Infested. [action][action]: Take X damage and discard Infested. X is the number of resource tokens on Infested.

cards.flavor:
"You said this wasn't a cult, Lainey."
"Good God, Fairmont, I said it was a society. Must you always be so gauche?"
cards.name: Elaine Duncan
cards.text: [[Criminal]], [[Miskatonic]], [[Silver Twilight]] deck only. Campaign mode only. You collect 1 additional resource during each upkeep phase. [reaction] Spend X resources and exhaust Elaine Duncan: You get +X to a test you are taking. Forced - At the end of the scenario, if Elaine Duncan is in play: You may exile 1 unique non-weakness, non-story [[Ally]], [[Tome]], or [[Relic]] card and may not include a card with that title in your deck for the remainder of the campaign. If you do not, you receive 1 mental trauma.

cards.back_flavor: In the old country, Simone was a legend. The people of Anse-A-Pitres still whisper tales of her bravery, how she stood firm against the shadows that crept along the twisted paths of her village- but those days are long past. Since making a home for herself in faraway Arkham, Simone has worked tirelessly to create a safe haven for its small community of Haitian expatriates. But now, she can sense the same tendrils of malevolence that threatened her and her family in the old country stretching across the sea and throughout her new home, and she knows that she can no longer rest. For the sake of her daughters, the time has come for Simone to face the darkness head-on.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Spell]] assets 0-4, up to 10 other Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 copy of Sigil of Ezrulie Dantor, 1 copy of Marinette Bwa-Chèche, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Firearm]] cards.
cards.flavor: "The spirit is a big thing.  Time and distance cannot shrink it."
cards.name: Simone Toussaint
cards.text:
[reaction] After you activate an [action] ability on a [[Spell]] asset: Ignore any charge, secret, and/or exhaust costs that ability may require. (Limit once per round.)
[free]You may spend a charge on a [[Spell]] asset under your control to draw a card. (Limit once per turn.)
[elder_sign]: +1.  You may spend a charge on a [[Spell]] asset under your control to automatically succeed.

cards.flavor: Your bitter patron has come to collect her due, and she demands payment in blood.
cards.name: Marinette Bwa-Chèche
cards.text: Simone Toussaint deck only. Revelation - Discard each asset in your arcane slots. Put Marinette Bwa-Chèche into play under your control. She cannot leave play while she has less than 3 resources on her. Forced - While Marinette Bwa-Chèche is in play, you do not have Arcane slots. [reaction] After you succeed at a Fight action, put 1 resource on Marinette Bwa-Chèche from the token bank. If there are 3 or more resource tokens on Marinette Bwa-Chèche, discard her.

cards.name: Whispering Voices
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Whispering Voices to the non-[[Elite]] enemy in play furthest from all investigators. If there are no such enemies in play, shuffle Whispering Voices back into your deck. If the attached enemy is discarded from play or defeated, shuffle Whispering Voices back into your deck. Forced - At the end of your turn: Move your investigator once towards the attached enemy. Then, if that enemy engages you before the end of the round, discard Whispering Voices.

cards.name: Sigil of Ezrulie Dantor
cards.text:
Simone Toussaint deck only.
[free] Attach a [[Spell]] asset with "Uses (charges)" to Sigil of Ezrulie Dantor.  This asset does not take up any slots. (Limit 2 attached assets.)
[reaction] When you perform a test on a [[Spell]] asset attached to Sigil of Ezrulie Dantor: Draw a card.

cards.back_flavor: Despite Colin's natural aptitude for figures, he had never been able to convert that skill into tangible riches.  Instead, he has spent the last several years keeping the Sheldon Gang's gambling accounts in check. When Colin discovered a way to skim off the top of their ill-gotten earnings, he didn't hesitate for even a second; the Sheldons were deserving victims, and Colin could use the funds to support his sickly younger sister and have enough cash left over to find solace in his vices- cigarettes and drink. Over the past several months, the Sheldons have began dropping like flies, and Colin can't help but feel a sick sense of satisfaction.  Little does he know the reason behind the Sheldon's downfall is far from mundane- and that those responsible intend to hold him accountable by association.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Illicit]] cards 0-2, up to 10 other Rogue event cards ([rogue]) level 0-2. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 copy of Sheldon Family Ledger, 1 copy of Black Lung, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "Once you see the world for what it really is, you'll pick up a habit too."
cards.name: Colin Montgomery
cards.text:
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more, you may play an event card from your hand, paying its cost.  If that event card was fast, it costs 2 less resources. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign]: +0.  Shuffle an event card in your discard pile back into your deck.

cards.flavor: "Don't worry. If this was dangerous, I'd have stopped doing it by now."
cards.name: Sheldon Family Ledger
cards.text: Colin Montgomery deck only. [action] Exhaust Sheldon Family Ledger and choose one: - Gain 2 resources. You may shuffle an event card in your discard pile back into your deck. - Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, you may search the top 3 cards of your deck for an event card and add it to your hand.

cards.flavor: Something claws at you from the inside. Your breath is cinder-choked and burning.
cards.name: Black Lung
cards.text: Colin Montgomery deck only. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Remove each event in your discard pile from the game. - Discard each event from your hand. Take 1 horror for each card discarded in this way. If you cannot do either, take 1 horror and shuffle this card back into your deck.

cards.back_flavor: When the O'Bannion gang needs to turn up the heat on a crooked cop or a corrupt politician, you can bet that Elspeth 'Elsie' Malone had a hand in collecting the dirty little secrets that keep Arkham's elite under the O'Bannions' thumb. Now, Elsie's looking to cut a deal with the Arkham P.D.; the O'Bannions are up to their ears in trouble, and she'll need to jump ship now if she doesn't want to drown in the mess they've made.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards with "Uses (secrets)" level 0-5, up to 5 other Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 copy of Quid Pro Quo, 1 copy of The Jig is Up!, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Setup: You begin each game with 1 copy of Quid Pro Quo set aside, out of play.
cards.flavor: "A dame that knows the ropes isn't likely to get tied up."
cards.name: Elsie Malone
cards.text:
Your assets with "Uses (secrets)" enter play with 1 additional secret on them.
[reaction] After you spend a secret on one of your assets: Add the set-aside Quid Pro Quo skill card to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. You may spend 2 secrets to automatically succeed.

cards.flavor: "If you want me to sing, copper, then we play by my rules."
cards.name: Quid Pro Quo
cards.text: Elsie Malone Deck only. Forced - When Quid Pro Quo would be discarded from anywhere: Set it aside, out of play, instead. Commit only to a skill test you are performing. Choose one: - Quid Pro Quo gains [wild][wild] for this test. - If this test is successful, gain 3 resources. - If this test is successful, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "...Aw, applesauce."
cards.name: The Jig is Up!
cards.text: Elsie Malone deck only. Revelation - For each of your assets with secrets on them, choose one: - Take 1 damage. - Remove that asset from the game. If you do not have any assets with secrets on them, shuffle The Jig is Up! back into your deck.

cards.back_flavor: Edith was brought into this world amidst opulence and ease, her life tethered to the machinations of men with agendas beyond her ken. Her mind was a sponge, absorbing every scrap of knowledge about the cosmos that her caretakers fed her. However, the deeper her understanding grew, the stronger her desire to shape her own destiny became. By carving the eldritch signs of these strange beings her masters served into her flesh, Edith has awakened to the beginnings of immense power- but she has yet to learn the harsh lesson that pride often precedes a fall.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30 Deckbuilding Options: Mystic [mystic] level 0-3, Neutral level 0-5, [[Occult]] cards 0-5, up to 3 level 0 permanents purchased at deck creation from any class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 copy of Written in Blood, 1 copy of Consumed, 1 bonded [[Engraving]] asset (see below), 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: You begin each scenario with Written in Blood in your opening hand. At deck creation, choose an [[Engraving]] asset from your 5 bonded cards to add to your deck. It is considered part of your Deckbuilding Requirements. For every 12 experience you've earned in total, you may randomly select a different [[Engraving]] asset from your bonded cards to add to your deck. Deckbuilding Restrictions: You may not have more than 3 bonded [[Engraving]] assets included in your deck.
cards.flavor: "The world doesn't owe you a thing. If you want something, it's up to you."
cards.name: Edith Foster
cards.text:
[reaction] When you succeed at a test on a card with a trait listed on an [[Engraving]] under your control: Draw 1 card or gain 1 resource.  (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign]: +X. X is the number of [[Engraving]] assets under your control.

cards.name: Written in Blood
cards.text:
Edith Foster deck only. Fast.
Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a card with a trait listed on one of your [[Engraving]] assets. You may add it to your hand or play that card (paying its cost).  Shuffle Written in Blood back into your deck.

cards.flavor:
"It is very hard for evil to take hold of the unconsenting soul."
- Ursula K. Le Guin
cards.name: Consumed
cards.text: Edith Foster deck only. Revelation - For each card under your control with a trait listed on one of your [[Engraving]] assets, take 1 horror. If you do not control any cards with traits listed on one of your [[Engraving]] assets, take 1 damage and shuffle Consumed back into your deck.

cards.name: Engraving of Blindness
cards.text: Permanent. Edith Foster deck only. You get +2 [combat] and +1 health. Your Deckbuilding Options gains the following text: "Up to 5 [[Relic]] Cards level 0-5."

cards.name: Engraving of Thresholds
cards.text: Permanent. Edith Foster deck only. You get +2 [agility] and +1 Sanity. Your Deckbuilding Options gains the following text: "Up to 5 [[Cursed]] cards level 0-5."

cards.name: Engraving of Masks
cards.text: Permanent. Edith Foster deck only. You get +2 [willpower] and +1 Sanity. Your Deckbuilding Options gains the following text: "Up to 5 [[Ritual]] Cards Level 0-5."

cards.back_flavor: With his effortless charm and debonair manner, young Sebastian is the toast of Arkham.  You'd think he was born with a silver spoon in his mouth, but nothing could be further from the truth. Few know the shocking reality of Sebastian's past, and what he had to do to get where he is today.  The instructions in the old grimoire he found were laid out in painstaking detail, and he followed them to the letter, signing the contract the creature he summoned offered him in blood.  Sebastian knows that his success comes with an eventual cost, and one day soon the great hellish prince he has bargained with will come to collect his due.  The world may be at Sebastian's fingertips for now, but how long will that last before he has to watch it burn?
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-3, Cards with "doom" level 0-5, [[Occult]] cards level 0, Neutral Cards level 0-5, up to 5 other level 0 Rogue and/or Mystic ([rogue] and/or[mystic]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 copy of Cain Adeon Esquire, 1 copy of Great Prince Camio, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "It's not you.  It's me."
cards.name: Sebastian Benítez
cards.text:
[reaction] After a skill test you are taking fails but before resolving its effects, place 1 doom on a non-permanent asset you control without doom: Attempt that test again. You get +2 skill value for this test. (Limit once per failed test.)
[free] Spend 2 resources and select a non-weakness asset you control with doom on it: Discard that asset.
[elder_sign]: +2.  You may remove 1 doom from an asset you control.

cards.name: Engraving of Visions
cards.text: Permanent. Edith Foster deck only. You get +2 [intellect] and +1 Health. Your Deckbuilding Options gains the following text: "Up to 5 [[Tome]] Cards level 0-5."

cards.name: Engraving of Sorrows
cards.text: Permanent. Edith Foster deck only. You get +1 Health and +1 Sanity. Your Deckbuilding Options gains the following text: "Up to 5 [[Spell]] Cards level 0-5."

cards.flavor:
"Come now, Sebastian. What are friends for?"
"...Are you actually waiting for me to answer?"
"Well, yes. I am terribly curious."
cards.name: Cain Adeon Esquire
cards.text:
Sebastian Benítez deck only.
[reaction] After doom is placed on a card you control with no doom on it, exhaust Cain Adeon Esquire and choose one:
- You gain 2 resources.
- Immediately disengage from 1 enemy at your location.  Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot engage or attack you.

cards.flavor: "I've so many questions. You'll indulge me, of course?"
cards.name: Great Prince Camio
cards.text: Sebastian Benítez deck only. Revelation - Put Great Prince Camio into play. Search your deck, discard pile and play area for Cain Adeon, Esquire and set him aside, out of play. While Great Prince Camio is in play, Sebastian Benítez cannot succeed at tests without triggering the [reaction] ability on his investigator card. [action] Take 1 direct damage and horror: Discard Great Prince Camio and shuffle Cain Adeon, Esquire back into your deck.

cards.name: Browning 1910
cards.text: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself."
- Carl Sagan
cards.name: Divinity Within
cards.text: Take up to 3 damage.  For each point of damage you take, you may heal 1 damage  from among investigators and/or [[Ally]] assets at your location.

cards.flavor:
"The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself."
- Carl Sagan
cards.name: Divinity Within
cards.text:
Fast.
Take up to 3 damage.  For each point of damage you take, you may heal 1 damage or horror from among investigators and/or [[Ally]] assets at your location.

cards.name: Suppressing Fire
cards.text:
Commit to a test on a [[Firearm]] asset. As an additional cost to commit this card, you may spend any amount of ammo on that asset.  Suppressing Fire gains X [combat] icons, where X is the total amount of ammo spent during this test.
If this test succeeds, you may draw 1 card for each ammo you spent during this action.

cards.name: "Cut 'em Off!"
cards.text:
Fast. Play when an enemy's Hunter or Patrol keyword would cause it to move into another investigator's location during this enemy phase. 
Move your investigator one location at a time to that enemy's location. If that enemy would make an attack against another investigator, you may choose to cancel it.

cards.name: "Cut 'em Off!"
cards.text:
Fast. Play when an enemy's Hunter or Patrol keyword would cause it to move into another investigator's location during this enemy phase. Move your investigator one location at a time to that enemy's location. If that enemy would make an attack against another investigator, you may choose to cancel it.
Then, take a Fight action against that enemy. This attack ignores the retaliate keyword.

cards.name: Ijaya Trinket
cards.text:
Uses (3 charges).  If Ijaya Trinket has no charges, discard it.
[reaction] After a non-[[Elite]] enemy attacks you, even if that attack was canceled: Spend 1 charge and exhaust Ijaya Trinket. That enemy does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

cards.flavor: "Maman used to say it was natural to resist the call, but the lwa always get their way in the end."
cards.name: Margot Toussaint
cards.text: Your arcane slots can be used to hold cards that take up hand slots. Forced - When you would perform an action printed on an asset that uses a hand slot, you use [willpower] instead of the skill indicated, and you must treat each skill icon printed in that asset's text as if it is a [willpower].

cards.name: Ijaya Trinket
cards.text:
Uses (3 charges).  If Ijaya Trinket has no charges, discard it.
[reaction] When an enemy attacks you, spend 1 charge and exhaust Ijaya Trinket: Cancel that attack. If that enemy is non-[[Elite]], exhaust that enemy and it does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

cards.name: Lewis Mk IV
cards.text: Uses (6 ammo). Forced - If Lewis Mk IV is ready: You may not move except via encounter card effects. [free] Exhaust Lewis Mk IV. [action] If Lewis Mk IV is ready, spend 1 Ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may spend 1 additional ammo to deal this attack's damage to an additional enemy at your location. (Limit once per attack)

cards.name: Lewis Mk IV
cards.text: Uses (8 ammo). Forced - If Lewis Mk IV is ready: You may not move except via encounter card effects. [free] Exhaust Lewis Mk IV. [action] If Lewis Mk IV is ready, spend 1 Ammo: Fight. You get +3 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may spend 1 additional ammo to deal this attack's damage to an additional enemy at your location, or 2 additional ammo to deal this attack's damage to enemy at a connecting location instead. (Limit once per attack)

cards.name: Pugilist
cards.text: Limit 1 per investigator. While your hand slots do not contain any [[Weapon]] or [[Melee]] assets, you deal +1 damage on Fight actions that test [combat].

cards.name: Pugilist
cards.text: Permanent. Exceptional. While your hand slots do not contain any [[Weapon]] or [[Melee]] assets, you get +2 on Fight actions that test [combat] and you deal +1 damage.

cards.flavor:
"But I don't want to die!"
"Oh, be quiet! People die!  It's practically what we're made for!"
cards.name: Show of Bravery
cards.text: For each point of horror on your investigator, this card loses an icon of your choice.

cards.name: Spirit Transference
cards.text:
Fast. Play when an [[Ally]] asset at your location is defeated or discarded by an encounter card effect.
Search your deck for an [[Ally]] asset with a different title and add it to your hand.

cards.name: Spirit Transference
cards.text:
Fast. Play when an [[Ally]] asset at your location is defeated or discarded by an encounter card effect.
Search your deck or discard pile for an [[Ally]] asset with a different title. You may either add it to your hand or play it, paying its cost.

cards.flavor:
"A milligram of caution is worth a double quintal of remorse."
-Seabury Quinn
cards.name: Precautionary Measures
cards.text:
Permanent. Exceptional.
[reaction] After you resolve a revelation effect drawn by another investigator or remove a non-Weakness treachery from another investigator's threat area: Place 1 resource token on Precautionary Measures as evidence.
[free]Spend 1 evidence and exhaust Precautionary Measures: You get +2 to a test you are taking. Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "We may draw good out of evil; we must not do evil, that good may come." -Maria Weston Chapman
cards.name: Apotropaic Ward
cards.text: [reaction] After you draw a treachery from the encounter deck, exhaust Apotropaic Ward and place 1 doom on it: Cancel that treachery.

cards.flavor: "We may draw good out of evil; we must not do evil, that good may come." -Maria Weston Chapman
cards.name: Apotropaic Ward
cards.text:
[reaction] After you draw a treachery from the encounter deck, exhaust Apotropaic Ward and place 1 doom on it: Cancel that treachery.
[free] If there is 3 or more doom on Apotropaic Ward: 
Return Apotropaic Ward to your hand.

cards.name: Chthonic Channel
cards.text: When you commit this card to a skill test, remove up to 2 doom on an asset under your control. For each doom spent in this way, this card gains [wild][wild].

cards.name: Celestial Boline
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Celestial Boline: Fight. You may use [willpower] instead of [combat] for this attack. You get +1 skill value and deal +1 damage for this attack. If this attack is successful, you may shuffle a [[Spell]] card from your discard pile back into your deck. If this attack does not defeat an enemy, place 1 doom on that enemy. (This doom may cause the agenda to advance.)

cards.name: Celestial Boline
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You may add your [willpower] to your [combat] for this attack and you deal +1 damage. If this attack is successful, you may add a [[Spell]] card from your discard pile to your hand. If this attack does not defeat an enemy, place 1 doom on that enemy. (This doom may cause the agenda to advance.)

cards.name: Expel the Spirit
cards.text: Search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck for a non-[[Elite]] enemy or treachery.  You may place 1 doom on a card you control to discard it or place it on the bottom of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Expel the Spirit
cards.text:
Search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck for a non-[[Elite]] enemy or treachery and choose one:-  Discard that card or place it on the bottom of the encounter deck. Put 1 doom on an asset under your control.
- Place 2 doom on an asset under your control. Then, put that enemy or treachery in the victory display and attach Expel the Spirit to it.

cards.flavor:
"Wisdom is born of wonder."
- St. Gregory the Great
cards.name: Inner Universe
cards.text: For each of your arcane slots that is filled, you may discover 1 clue at your location.

cards.flavor:
"Wisdom is born of wonder."
- St. Gregory the Great
cards.name: Inner Universe
cards.text:
Fast.
For each of your arcane slots that is filled, you may discover a clue at your location or at a connecting location.

cards.flavor: "To define is to limit."
cards.name: Luca Gasparotto
cards.text:
[reaction] When doom would be placed on a card under your control, deal 1 damage to Luca Gasparotto and exhaust him: Cancel that doom.
[reaction] When doom would be removed from a card under your control: Heal 1 damage from Luca Gasparotto instead.

cards.flavor: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it."
cards.name: Luca Gasparotto
cards.text:
[reaction] When doom would be placed on a card under your control, deal 1 damage to Luca Gasparotto: Cancel that doom.
[reaction] When doom is removed from a card under your control: Heal 1 damage from Luca Gasparotto.

cards.name: Malediction
cards.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[reaction] When any amount of doom is placed on a card under your control, exhaust Malediction and spend 1 charge:  Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location or discover 1 clue at your location.

cards.name: Malediction
cards.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[reaction] When any amount of doom is placed on a card under your control, exhaust Malediction or spend 1 charge:  Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location, discover 1 clue at your location, or add 1 charge to Malediction.

cards.name: Ouija Board
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. You may investigate as if you were at a revealed connecting location and you may use [willpower] instead of [intellect] for this investigation. You may treat the modifier of each [skull] or [cultist] drawn during this test as if it is a 0. Each time you choose to do so, put 1 doom on Ouija Board.

cards.name: Ouija Board
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. You may investigate as if you were at a revealed connecting location and you may use [willpower] instead of [intellect] for this investigation. You get +2 for this investigation. You may treat the modifier of each non-[auto_fail] symbol drawn during this test as if it is a 0. Each time you choose to do so, put 1 doom on Ouija Board.

cards.flavor:
"In chaos, there is fertility."
-Anais Nin
cards.name: Strange Attractor
cards.text: If this test fails, you may place 1 doom on an asset under your control to cancel all effects of this test.

cards.name: The Gospel of Aradia
cards.text: [reaction] After you cancel or discard a non-weakness treachery from play, exhaust The Gospel of Aradia and place 1 doom on it: Attach that card to The Gospel of Aradia. For each card attached to The Gospel of Aradia, you get +2 to skill tests made on [[Spell]] cards. Forced - If the encounter deck runs out of cards or the encounter discard pile is shuffled back into the deck: Remove 1 card attached to The Gospel of Aradia and shuffle it back into the encounter deck, or put 1 doom on The Gospel of Aradia.

cards.name: Wake the Dead
cards.text: Attach Wake the Dead to a non-[[Elite]] enemy in the encounter discard pile and put it in your play area with 1 doom on it. While it is in your play area, treat this enemy as an [[Ally]] asset with the [[Geist]] trait with health equal to its enemy health value. (It takes up an [[Ally]] slot.) Forced - If the attached card would be defeated or doom would be removed from it: That enemy makes an immediate attack against you and is discarded.

cards.name: Wake the Dead
cards.text: Attach Wake the Dead to a non-[[Elite]] enemy in the encounter discard pile and put it in your play area with 1 doom on it. While it is in your play area, treat this enemy as an [[Ally]] asset with the [[Geist]] trait with health equal to its enemy health value. (It takes up an [[Ally]] slot.) Forced - If the attached card would be defeated: That enemy makes an immediate attack against you and is discarded. You may add 1 doom to it to heal it to its full health and cancel this effect.

cards.flavor: It's not really gambling if you never lose.
cards.name: Beginner's Luck
cards.text:
You may commit this card to any test.
For each card remaining in the act deck, this card gains one [wild] (to a maximum of 4.)

cards.name: Hard Bargain
cards.text: When you commit this card to a test, you may spend up to 3 resources.  If this test succeeds: For each resource spent, you may add 1 ammo, evidence, or supply to an asset under your control.

cards.flavor: Right in the kisser.
cards.name: Chin Music
cards.text: Fight. This attack ignores the aloof keyword. If you succeed, gain 1 resource for each point you succeeded by (to a maximum of 5 resources.)

cards.flavor: They were asking for it.
cards.name: Chin Music
cards.text: Fight. This attack ignores the aloof, retaliate and elusive keywords. If you succeed, gain 1 resource for each point you succeeded by (to a maximum of five.) If you succeeded by 2 or more, this attack does +1 damage.

cards.name: Duelist
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
While there is only 1 enemy engaged with you, you may use [agility] in place of [combat] when taking fight actions on [[Melee]] assets, and may treat all modifiers to your [combat] on that asset as if they modify your [agility] instead.

cards.name: Duelist
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
While there is only 1 enemy engaged with you, you may use [agility] in place of [combat] when taking fight actions on [[Melee]] assets, and may treat all modifiers to your [combat] on that asset as if they modify your [agility] instead. When you choose to do so, you get +2 [agility] and ignore the Retaliate keyword.

cards.name: Entourage
cards.text: You get 1 additional [[Ally]] slot, which can only hold non-unique allies. Forced - At the beginning of each round, if there is a card in the [[Ally]] slot granted by Entourage: Pay 1 resource. If you cannot, discard that card.

cards.name: Entourage
cards.text: You get 2 additional [[Ally]] slots. Forced - At the beginning of each round, you may either pay 1 resource for each card in an [[Ally]] slot granted by Entourage or discard an [[Illicit]] card from your hand. If you cannot, discard each card in an [[Ally]] slot granted by Entourage.

cards.flavor:
"Style is the perfection of a point of view."
-Richard Eberhart
cards.name: Grand Entrance
cards.text:
Fast. Play when you would move into an unrevealed location, but before that location is revealed.
Reveal that location and Test [agility] (X). X is the shroud of the location you have just revealed. If you succeed: You gain X resources and you may exhaust a non-[[Elite]] enemy at this location.

cards.name: Bon Voyage
cards.text:
Fast. Play when you would take a resign action.
Distribute your remaining resources between all remaining investigators. (Max 5 resources per remaining investigator.) You may begin the next scenario with an additional card in your opening hand.

cards.flavor: "What I offer is treasure far better than silver or gold."
cards.name: Madame Bilqis
cards.text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 3 or more, exhaust Madame Bilqis and choose one:
- Spend 1 resource. Choose a card committed to that test and shuffle it back into your deck.
- Spend 1 resource. You get +2 to your next test.
- Spend 3 resources. You may immediately take an action as if it were your turn (this action does not count toward the number of actions you can take each turn. Limit once per round).

cards.flavor: "What could be more valuable than joy of the heart?"
cards.name: Madame Bilqis
cards.text:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Madame Bilqis and 
choose 1:
- Spend 1 resource. Choose a card committed to that test and shuffle it back into your deck. Draw a card.
- Spend 1 resource. You get +3 to your next test. Draw a card.
- Spend 2 resources. You may immediately take an action as if it were your turn (this action does not count toward the number of actions you can take each turn. Limit once per round). Draw a card.

cards.name: Model 10 Remington
cards.text: Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +3 [combat] to this attack and deal +1 damage. If this attack succeeds, you may spend 1 additional ammo to deal 1 extra damage. [free] If there is 1 or fewer ammo on Model 10 Remington, spend 2 resources: Put 1 ammo on Model 10 Remington. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
"If you owe the bank $100, that's your problem.  If you owe the bank $100 million, that's their problem."
-Jean Paul Getty Sr.
cards.name: Shakedown
cards.text:
Fast. Play when an enemy at your location is defeated.
You gain X resources. X is equal to that enemy's evade value.

cards.flavor: The score never interested you - only the game.
cards.name: Stack the Deck
cards.text:
Fast. Play when you would fail at a skill test.
X is the amount that you would have failed by. This test succeeds by 0, instead. Remove Stack the Deck from the game.

cards.name: The Tear of Ezrulie Freda
cards.text:
Exceptional. Uses (2 charges). 
[reaction] At the beginning of your turn, Replenish one charge on The Tear of Ezrulie Freda.
[action] Spend 1 charge on The Tear of Ezrulie Freda. Choose one:
- Gain 3 resources.
- Draw 2 cards.
- Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location.

cards.name: Wiretap
cards.text:
Uses (4 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply and X resources: Discover a clue at a connecting location.  If an enemy is at that location, X is half that location's shroud.  Otherwise, X is that location's shroud.

cards.name: Wiretap
cards.text:
Uses (4 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply and X resources: Discover a clue at a connecting location.  X is half that location's shroud.  If a non-[[Elite]] enemy is at that location, you may automatically exhaust it.

cards.name: Detachment
cards.text: [[Artist]], [[Blessed]], [[Drifter]], [[Scholar]] deck only. Permanent. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - Your investigator gains Deckbuilding Restrictions: No non-signature or non-weakness [[Item]] or [[Ally]] cards. You get +1 [intellect], +1 [willpower], and +1 Sanity. [reaction] When you play an event card, exhaust Detachment: That card either gains fast or costs 2 less resources.

cards.name: Dredge the Past
cards.text:
Shuffle an [[Insight]] event in your discard pile back into your deck.
[reaction] If Dredge the Past is in your discard pile, you may choose to add it to your hand instead of drawing a card during the upkeep phase.

cards.name: Dredge the Past
cards.text:
Fast.
Shuffle an event in your discard pile back into your deck.
[reaction] If Dredge the Past is in your discard pile, you may choose to add it to your hand instead of drawing a card during the upkeep phase.

cards.name: Magnum Opus
cards.text: You may commit this card to any test. Do not reveal chaos tokens for this test. This test automatically succeeds and the performing investigator is considered to have drawn the [elder_sign] token. After this test resolves, put Magnum Opus in the victory display. Forced - While Magnum Opus is in the victory display, its owner cannot investigate, fight, evade, play cards, or activate abilities on player cards.

cards.flavor:
"It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it."
-Oscar Wilde
cards.name: Pore Over
cards.text: When you play Pore Over, search the top 9 cards of your deck for an event card and play it as if it were in your hand (paying its cost.)  Then, you may choose a different event in your discard pile to shuffle back into your deck.

cards.name: Physician's Gladstone
cards.text:
You have 2 additional hand slots, which may only be used to hold [[Tool]] or [[Science]] assets.
Investigators at your location may use supplies on assets held in slots granted by Physician's Gladstone as if they were on any asset at your location.

cards.flavor: "I can still see her face, almost as it was yesterday..."
cards.name: Professor Niall O'Farrell
cards.text: [reaction] When you play an [[Insight]] event from your hand, exhaust Professor Niall O'Farrell: Shuffle a copy of that card from your discard pile back into your deck. You get +1 [intellect] until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: "After all this time, I still can't get her smile just right."
cards.name: Professor Niall O'Farrell
cards.text:
While you have 6 or more cards in your hand, you get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] When you play an event from your hand, exhaust Professor Niall O'Farrell and choose one:- Search your deck for a copy of that card and play it as well (paying its cost).
- Shuffle a copy of that card from your discard pile back into your deck.

cards.name: Saturnine Foresight
cards.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[reaction] At the beginning of the Mythos phase, spend 1 charge: Discard cards from the top of your deck until a card with at least one [wild] symbol is revealed.  Commit that card to each test that takes place during this mythos phase. If a weakness is discarded during this process, shuffle it back into your deck.

cards.name: Saturnine Foresight
cards.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[reaction] At the beginning of the Mythos phase, spend 1 charge: Reveal cards from the top of your deck until a card with at least one [wild] symbol is revealed.  Commit that card to each test that takes place during this mythos phase. At the end of the mythos phase, add that card to your hand and shuffle each other revealed card back into your deck.

cards.name: Synaesthesia
cards.text:
When you would commit a skill card to any test, commit Synaesthesia to that test as well.  Treat all skill icons on that card as if they were [wild].
If you succeed, shuffle that skill card back into its bearer's deck.

cards.name: The Triangular Manuscript
cards.text:
If there is a card attached to The Triangular Manuscript, you get +1 [intellect] while investigating.
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test on an event card by 3 or more, exhaust The Triangular Manuscript: Attach that card to The Triangular Manuscript. (Limit 1 attached card.)
[reaction] After you discover the last clue from a location, exhaust The Triangular Manuscript: Add the card attached to The Triangular Manuscript to your hand.

cards.name: The Triangular Manuscript
cards.text:
If there is a card attached to The Triangular Manuscript, you get +1 [intellect]. If there are 3 cards attached to The Triangular Manuscript, you also get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test on an event card, exhaust The Triangular Manuscript: Attach that card to The Triangular Manuscript. (Limit 3 attached cards.)
[reaction] After you discover the last clue from a location, exhaust The Triangular Manuscript: Add a card attached to The Triangular Manuscript to your hand.

cards.name: Specimen Collection
cards.text:
Investigators at your location may use resource tokens on Specimen Collection to pay for Asset or Event cards.
[reaction] After an enemy is defeated at your location, exhaust Specimen Collection: Put 1 resource token on Specimen Collection from the token bank.

cards.flavor:
"Our propagation of the native Solanaceae specimens found during Dr. Fischer's expedition to the Lemurian continent has proven successful; unfortunately, all produce unpleasant 'screaming' noises when handled. 
Earplugs have proven to be comically ineffective."
--- From the notes of Professor E. Coleman, Miskatonic University Botany Dept.
cards.name: Mandrake Root
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge and exhaust Mandrake Root: Evade. Automatically evade an enemy at your location. If that enemy is non-[[Elite]], you may discover 1 clue at your location.

cards.name: Entomologist's Almanac
cards.text: [reaction] After an enemy spawns at your location, place 1 resource (from the token pool) on this card, as evidence. (Limit once per game at each location.) [free] Spend 2 evidence from Entomologist's Almanac and exhaust it: Discard a non-weakness treachery card at your location.

cards.name: Undivided Attention
cards.text: Fast. Attach Undivided Attention to your location. Until the end of the round, investigators at this location get +2 skill value when investigating and -2 skill value to tests of any other kind. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Undivided Attention.

cards.name: Undivided Attention
cards.text:
Fast.
Attach Undivided Attention to your location. Investigators at this location get +2 skill value when investigating and -2 to tests of any other kind.
[action]: Shuffle Undivided Attention back into your deck.

cards.flavor: You're the air and they're dying to breathe.
cards.name: Allure
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] When you fail a test: Gain 1 resource. (Limit once per round.)
[reaction] When you pass a test: Draw a card. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Ambition
cards.text: [reaction] After you fail a test, exhaust Ambition: The next time you would attempt that test this round, you get +1 skill value.

cards.name: Ambition
cards.text: [reaction] After you fail a test, exhaust Ambition: The next time you would attempt that test this round, you either get +2 skill value or you may spend X resources to automatically succeed.  X is the difficulty level of that test.

cards.name: Blessing of Guede Nibo
cards.text:
Fast. Play when an [[Ally]] asset at your location would be defeated.
Shuffle that card back into its owner's deck or add X [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.  X is the amount of damage and horror on that ally before it was defeated.

cards.name: Blessing of Guede Nibo
cards.text:
Fast. Play when an [[Ally]] asset at your location would be defeated.
Shuffle that card back into its owner's deck and add X [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.  X is the amount of damage and horror on that ally before it was defeated.

cards.name: Captured Imagination
cards.text:
If this test is successful, you may immediately play the topmost event card in your discard pile (paying its cost.)
If this test fails, you may shuffle the topmost event card in your discard pile back into your deck.

cards.name: Ezrulie-je-Wouj's Bâton
cards.subname: Illusory Mace of the Red Loa
cards.text: [[Chosen]], [[Dreamer]], [[Sorcerer]], [[Warden]] deck only. Uses (3 charges). [action]: Fight. You get +2 to this attack and you may use [willpower] or [agility] instead of [combat]. You deal +2 damage for this attack. As an additional cost to use this ability, you must spend 1 charge or discard an asset in your play area.

cards.name: Patched Up
cards.text: If this test is successful: Heal 1 damage from your investigator or an [[Ally]] asset under your control.

cards.flavor: There is but one life for each to give.
cards.name: Nora Barber
cards.text:
[free] Deal 1 horror to Nora Barber: Heal 1 damage or horror from an investigator at your location.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, discard Nora Barber: Heal 2 damage or horror from an investigator at your location.

cards.flavor: Some of us spend our entire lives giving.
cards.name: Nora Barber
cards.text:
[free] Deal 1 horror to Nora Barber: Heal 1 damage or horror from an investigator at your location and shuffle a card from your discard pile back into your deck.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, shuffle Nora Barber back into your deck: Heal 2 damage or horror from an investigator at your location.

cards.name: Terrifying Realization
cards.text:
Fast. 
Until the end of the round, each time you take any amount of horror you may discover 1 clue at your location.

cards.name: Terrifying Realization
cards.text:
Fast. 
Until the end of the round, whenever you take any amount of horror: Discover X clues at your location.  X is the amount of horror you have taken this turn.

cards.name: Torch Song
cards.text:
Play only during your turn.
Immediately end your turn. During the next enemy phase, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot resolve their Hunter or Patrol keywords.

cards.name: Torch Song
cards.text:
Play only during your turn.
Immediately end your turn. During the next enemy phase, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot resolve their Hunter or Patrol keywords. If an [[Elite]] enemy would engage or attack you during this phase, you may immediately cancel that effect and move to a connecting location without enemies.

cards.name: Virtuoso
cards.text:
[[Artist]], [[Dreamer]], [[Performer]] deck only. Permanent. Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] When a card effect would cause you to discard a card from your hand or play area, exhaust Virtuoso: Shuffle a different card in your discard pile back into your deck.

cards.name: Mischievous Psychopomp
cards.text: [reaction] After an investigator at your location fails a skill test: Search the chaos bag for a non-[auto_fail] token of your choice and seal it on Mischievous Psychopomp. (Maximum 1 total tokens sealed.) Forced - At the end of the round: Return the token sealed on Mischievous Psychopomp to the chaos bag.

cards.name: Sophisticated Parasol
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You may use [agility] instead of [combat] for this attack. As an additional cost to use this ability, you may discard any number of cards from your hand. You get +1 skill value to this attack for each card discarded in this way. If you discarded 1 or more cards, this attack deals +1 damage. Forced - After taking the above action, if you have 2 or less cards in your hand: Discard Sophisticated Parasol.

cards.name: Mischievous Psychopomp
cards.text: While a token is sealed on Mischievous Psychopomp, you get +1 [willpower]. [reaction] After an investigator at your location fails a skill test: Search the chaos bag for a non-[auto_fail] token of your choice and seal it on Mischievous Psychopomp. (Maximum 3 total tokens sealed.) Forced - At the end of the round: Return each token sealed on Mischievous Psychopomp to the chaos bag.

cards.name: Sophisticated Parasol
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You may use [agility] instead of [combat] for this attack. As an additional cost to use this ability, you may discard any number of cards from your hand. You get +2 skill value to this attack for each card discarded in this way. If you discarded at least 1 card, this attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy, you may return a card from your discard pile to your hand. Forced - After taking the above action, if you have no cards in your hand: Discard Sophisticated Parasol.

cards.name: Goetic Patron
cards.text: [[Cultist]], [[Cursed]], [[Scholar]], [[Sorcerer]] deck only. When Goetic Patron enters play, choose a type of asset slot. (Hand, Body, Arcane, Ally, Tarot, Accessory.) You get 1 additional slot of that type. Forced - When you would use any printed ability on an asset in a slot granted by Goetic Patron: Put 1 doom on that asset. This doom may cause the agenda to advance.

cards.flavor:
Is it working?
Oh... oh. Yeah, it's working.
cards.name: Morphine
cards.text: [[Agency]], [[Criminal]], [[Miskatonic]], [[Medic]] deck only. Uses (3 supplies). Forced - At the end of your turn, if Morphine is ready: You take all damage on Morphine. You may choose to take this damage as horror, instead. [reaction] When you would take any amount of damage, spend 1 supply and exhaust Morphine: Put that damage on Morphine.

cards.name: Favor of La Sirène
cards.text:
[[Artist]], [[Blessed]], [[Drifter]], [[Warden]] deck only.
Limit 1 per investigator.
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [agility].
Non-direct damage and/or horror assigned to investigators at your location must instead be assigned to Favor of La Sirène, if possible.
